meanings.definition: A person who feels strong dislike or disgust for something.
meanings.sent1: She is one of the loathers of horror movies.
meanings.sent2: The loathers of spicy food always choose mild options.
meanings.sent3: The loathers of vegetables made a funny face when offered a salad.
meanings.sent4: The loathers of early mornings cringed at the sound of the alarm clock.
meanings.sent5: The loathers of rainy days stayed indoors with a frown on their faces.

meanings.definition: Those who have an intense aversion or hatred towards something.
meanings.sent1: The loathers of public speaking avoid presentations at all costs.
meanings.sent2: In the crowd, the loathers of crowds felt overwhelmed and anxious.
meanings.sent3: The loathers of long meetings groaned when the agenda was announced.
meanings.sent4: The loathers of change resisted every new idea with all their might.
meanings.sent5: The loathers of conflict always sought peaceful resolutions.
